constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 21 (Thursday, February 4, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. HUFFMAN:
H.R. 815.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2: The Congress shall have
Power to dispose of and make all needful Rules and
Regulations respecting the Territory or other Property
belonging to the United States.
[Page H387]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

title: Arctic Refuge Protection Act
